status_info: We are still developing and optimizing this protocol

components.data: Receive oesophagus sample in solution.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Receive oesophagus sample in solution.

components.data: Wash the samples with 10ml cold PBS to remove any residual contamination, stomach content and loose mucus.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash the samples with 10ml cold PBS to remove any residual contamination, stomach content and loose mucus.

components.data: Pour oesophagus onto 100mm glass petri dish and add another 10ml fresh cold PBS.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pour oesophagus onto 100mm glass petri dish and add another 10ml fresh cold PBS.

components.data:
Open the samples longitudinally.

  • Epithelium should be a relatively loose, yellowish layer on the lumen side.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Open the samples longitudinally.

  • Epithelium should be a relatively loose, yellowish layer on the lumen side.

components.data:
Using two forceps separate the epithelium from stroma. Place them onto separate 100mm petri dishes each with 10ml PBS.

  • From this stage on only process the epithelium. To process the mucosa/submucosa see protocol “”.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Using two forceps separate the epithelium from stroma. Place them onto separate 100mm petri dishes each with 10ml PBS.

  • From this stage on only process the epithelium. To process the mucosa/submucosa see protocol “”.

components.data: Aspirate PBS.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Aspirate PBS.

components.data:
In a few drops of PBS (~200µl), finely mince the epithelium using two scalpels simultaneously.

  • Too much PBS in the dish will make it more difficult to mince.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
In a few drops of PBS (~200µl), finely mince the epithelium using two scalpels simultaneously.

  • Too much PBS in the dish will make it more difficult to mince.

components.data: Add 4ml Trypsin-EDTA 0.25% to the dish and transfer the tissue to a 50ml falcon tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 4ml Trypsin-EDTA 0.25% to the dish and transfer the tissue to a 50ml falcon tube.

components.data: Wash the scalpel and the dish with a further 1ml of Trypsin-EDTA 0.25% and transfer it into the Falcon with the tissue.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash the scalpel and the dish with a further 1ml of Trypsin-EDTA 0.25% and transfer it into the Falcon with the tissue.

components.data: Incubate the biopsies for 30 min at 37°C on a rocker.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate the biopsies for 30 min at 37°C on a rocker.

components.data: Add 50µl DNAse I dropwise to falcon to a final concentration of 100µg/ml.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 50µl DNAse I dropwise to falcon to a final concentration of 100µg/ml.

components.data: Incubate at room temperature for 5 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate at room temperature for 5 min.

components.data: Add 20ml of RPMI + 20% FBS to inactivate trypsin.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 20ml of RPMI + 20% FBS to inactivate trypsin.

components.data: Centrifuge at 200g for 2 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge at 200g for 2 minutes.

components.data: Pass the cells through 70µm cell strainer into 50ml falcon tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pass the cells through 70µm cell strainer into 50ml falcon tube.

components.data: Wash the Falcon Tube and the strainer with 5ml of RPMI with 20% FBS for total volume of 30ml (5ml of trypsin + 25ml of media).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash the Falcon Tube and the strainer with 5ml of RPMI with 20% FBS for total volume of 30ml (5ml of trypsin + 25ml of media).

components.data: Centrifuge at 500g for 5 minutes at 4°C. Remove supernatant.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge at 500g for 5 minutes at 4°C. Remove supernatant.

components.data: Wash the cells with 5ml Cold PBS.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash the cells with 5ml Cold PBS.

components.data: Centrifuge at 500g for 5 minutes at 4°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge at 500g for 5 minutes at 4°C.

components.data: Add 1ml Red Cell Lysis buffer to the pellet and resuspend by racking/tapping.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 1ml Red Cell Lysis buffer to the pellet and resuspend by racking/tapping.

components.data: Place on ice 5 min with periodic agitation.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place on ice 5 min with periodic agitation.

components.data: Add 10ml of Cold PBS.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 10ml of Cold PBS.

components.data: Centrifuge at 500g for 5 minutes. Remove supernatant
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge at 500g for 5 minutes. Remove supernatant

components.data: Resuspend in 1ml cold PBS with 0.04% BSA (8µl BSA/ml PBS).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Resuspend in 1ml cold PBS with 0.04% BSA (8µl BSA/ml PBS).

components.data: Filter through a 70µm cell strainer.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Filter through a 70µm cell strainer.

components.data: Count cells and viability using nucleocounter.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Count cells and viability using nucleocounter.

components.data:
If percentage of live cells is higher than 70-80%, cells can then be processed for scRNA-seq.

 

If percentage of live cells is below 70-80%, remove dead cells by following “Dead cell removal EasySep kit“.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
If percentage of live cells is higher than 70-80%, cells can then be processed for scRNA-seq.

 

If percentage of live cells is below 70-80%, remove dead cells by following “Dead cell removal EasySep kit“.

source_data.protocol_name: CGAP Dead cell removal EasySep kit with The Big Easy Magnet
source_data.protocol_name_html: CGAP Dead cell removal EasySep kit with The Big Easy Magnet

versions.protocol_name: CGAP Dead cell removal EasySep kit with The Big Easy Magnet
versions.protocol_name_html: CGAP Dead cell removal EasySep kit with The Big Easy Magnet

components.data: A single-cell suspension should have been prepared previously (e.g. by enzymatic dissociation of a tissue) and cells number and viability assessed using 1:1 trypan blue dilution.a.	A viability percentage below 70-80% usually justifies using this Dead Cell Removal protocol.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: A single-cell suspension should have been prepared previously (e.g. by enzymatic dissociation of a tissue) and cells number and viability assessed using 1:1 trypan blue dilution.a.	A viability percentage below 70-80% usually justifies using this Dead Cell Removal protocol.

components.data: Prepare 8ml of Recommended medium (PBS (8ml) + 2% FBS (160ul) + 1mM CaCl2 (1ul)).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare 8ml of Recommended medium (PBS (8ml) + 2% FBS (160ul) + 1mM CaCl2 (1ul)).

components.data: Centrifuge samples at 500g for 5 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge samples at 500g for 5 minutes.

components.data: Remove supernatant and resuspend in the appropriate volume of recommended medium (0.25 - 8ml) to obtain a suspension with 1 x 108 cells/ml.a.	If total number of cells is below 2.5 x 107, resuspend in the minimum volume, i.e. 0.25ml.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove supernatant and resuspend in the appropriate volume of recommended medium (0.25 - 8ml) to obtain a suspension with 1 x 108 cells/ml.a.	If total number of cells is below 2.5 x 107, resuspend in the minimum volume, i.e. 0.25ml.

components.data: Transfer cell suspension to a 15ml Falcon.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer cell suspension to a 15ml Falcon.

components.data: Add Dead Cell Removal (Annexin V) Cocktail to sample:a.	50uL per ml of sample.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add Dead Cell Removal (Annexin V) Cocktail to sample:a.	50uL per ml of sample.

components.data: Add Biotin Selection Cocktail to sample:a.	50uL per ml of sample.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add Biotin Selection Cocktail to sample:a.	50uL per ml of sample.

components.data: Mix (up and down with pipette) and incubate for 3 min at RT.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mix (up and down with pipette) and incubate for 3 min at RT.

components.data: Vortex RapidSpheres™ for 30 seconds.a.	Particles should appear evenly dispersed.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Vortex RapidSpheres™ for 30 seconds.a.	Particles should appear evenly dispersed.

components.data: Add RapidSpheres™ to sample and mix:a.	100μL per ml of sample.b.	No incubation, IMMEDIATELY move to next step.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add RapidSpheres™ to sample and mix:a.	100μL per ml of sample.b.	No incubation, IMMEDIATELY move to next step.

components.data: Add Recommended medium to top up the sample to the indicated volume:a.	Top up to 5ml for samples ≤ 2ml.b.	Top up to 10ml for samples > 2ml.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add Recommended medium to top up the sample to the indicated volume:a.	Top up to 5ml for samples ≤ 2ml.b.	Top up to 10ml for samples > 2ml.

components.data: Mix by gently pipetting up and down 2 -3 times.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mix by gently pipetting up and down 2 -3 times.

components.data: Place the tube (without lid) into the magnet and incubate for 3 mins at RT.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place the tube (without lid) into the magnet and incubate for 3 mins at RT.

components.data: Pick up the magnet, and in one continuous motion invert the magnet and tube, pouring the enriched cell suspension into a new tube.a.	 Leave the magnet and tube inverted for 2 - 3 seconds, then return upright. Do not shake or blot off any drops that may remain hanging from the mouth of the tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pick up the magnet, and in one continuous motion invert the magnet and tube, pouring the enriched cell suspension into a new tube.a.	 Leave the magnet and tube inverted for 2 - 3 seconds, then return upright. Do not shake or blot off any drops that may remain hanging from the mouth of the tube.

components.data: Count cells and viability using 1:1 trypan blue dilution.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Count cells and viability using 1:1 trypan blue dilution.

components.data: Add 5ml PBS with 0.04% BSA (200ul) to wash cells.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 5ml PBS with 0.04% BSA (200ul) to wash cells.

components.data: Centrifuge at 500g for 5 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge at 500g for 5 minutes.

components.data: Resuspend in appropriate volume of 0.04% BSA in PBS to run in Chromium.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Resuspend in appropriate volume of 0.04% BSA in PBS to run in Chromium.

components.data: Dilute cells to 2x106 cell per ml in 0.04% BSA and proceed to 10X Preparation for scRNA sequencing.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dilute cells to 2x106 cell per ml in 0.04% BSA and proceed to 10X Preparation for scRNA sequencing.

components.data: Ensure all unused tissue, equipment and tubes that have been in contact with primary tissue are placed into Virkon in sweetie jar for a minimum of 1 hour. After this time aspirate and disposing in relevant sharps or waste routes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Ensure all unused tissue, equipment and tubes that have been in contact with primary tissue are placed into Virkon in sweetie jar for a minimum of 1 hour. After this time aspirate and disposing in relevant sharps or waste routes.
